item.title: Optimization
item.description:
Introduction

In Machine Learning, the core problem is that solving the parameter estimation (model fitting), we want to find the values for a set of variable $\theta\in\Theta$, that minimized the scalar loss function or cost function $\mathcal{L}(\theta) \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$. This is called a optimization problem. $$ \theta^{opt} \in \arg\min \mathcal{L}(\theta) $$ We will assume that the parameter space is given by $\Theta \subseteq \mathbb{R}^D$, where $D$ is the number of variables being optimized over.
